p: In addition to reaffirming sovereign authority over biological samples, the WHO has more recently stated that countries have sovereign authority over their public health data. 114 In the wake of the West African Ebola epidemic, the WHO convened a consultation with scientists, journal editors, industry and government officials on 1–2 September 2015 with the aim of creating global norms for “timely and transparent sharing of data and results during public health emergencies”. 115 Although it is not explicitly stated, we can assume that this consultation dealt only with the sharing of information that is not already mandated under the IHR ( 2005). 116 An initial summary of the outcomes was released “immediately after the consultation” on the evening of the 2 September 2015 117:
